result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Irving Hayes III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Mental health evaluation.  Take all prescribed medications.

No contact with the Milwaukee Public Market.
Not to commit any acts that rise to the level of probable cause.

Cooperate with any assessments.  Comply with any treatment.
Sign all release forms.
AODA assessment. Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.

Court waived costs and surcharges due to the defendant's indigency.
Restitution set at zero.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Paige Aleece Styler in court, defendant Robert Irving Hayes not in court, in custody.  Jeffrey James Altenburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statement by defense counsel that defendant does not wish to remain in the program.  Court takes no action.

Defendant Robert Irving Hayes in court with attorney Paige Aleece Styler.  Defendant Robert Irving Hayes in custody.  Jeffrey James Altenburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviewed defendant's willingness to participate in the program.  Court ordered another court date to have a final determination of the defendant's desire to participate in the program. Case adjourned to Branch 36.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert Irving Hayes in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Jeffrey James Altenburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Amended information filed charging Count 1:  Theft (Value Not Exceeding $2500), pursuant to Wisc. stats. 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a), 939.51(3)(a); and Count 2: Disorderly Conduct, pursuant to Wisc. stat. 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b).
As to both counts in the amended information as charged:
Defendant waived  rights and pled guilty.
Guilty Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights and Elements of Criminal Offenses - Felonies received and filed.
Defendant examined as to his plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Judgment of Conviction entered.
.
Sentencing continued....
.
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. 
As to count 1: 
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive,  with credit for 155 days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for up to 2 years with the following conditions:
- Serve 90 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Defendant to have no contact with the Milwaukee Public Market.
- Commit no acts that rise to the level of probable cause.
-  Defendant cooperate with any assessments and comply with any treatment.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Sign all release forms.
- Court set -0- restitution.
.
As to count 2:
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 3 months in the House of Correction, consecutive,  with credit for -0- days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for up to 2 years with the following conditions:
- Defendant to have no contact with the Milwaukee Public Market.
- Commit no acts that rise to the level of probable cause.
-  Defendant cooperate with any assessments and comply with any treatment.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Sign all release forms.

Court waived costs and surcharges due to the defendant's indigency.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
The next court date is in Branch 36.  
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert Irving Hayes in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for status conference. Parties advise the Court the defendant was accepted to veteran's court and Branch 36 has preapproved the transfer of this case. Court allowed the transfer of this case to Branch 36 for resolution. Case adjourned to Branch 36.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Robert Irving Hayes in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp on behalf of Deann Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Discussion regarding the defendant's placement at United Community Center and the agency providing treatment. Defense counsel withdraws the speedy trial demand. Parties are seeking to have this matter transferred to mental health court. Court ordered this matter be set for a status conference to make sure the case was accepted into the mental health court. Parties anticipate a resolution in this matter. Court vacated the jury trial date of 9/16/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Status conference scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Turn over to Justice Point to allow the defendant to be transferred to the United Community Center.

Defendant Robert Irving Hayes in court with attorney Paige Aleece Styler.  Defendant Robert Irving Hayes in custody.  Jeffrey James Altenburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Judge Rothstein is on the bench doing a motion.  This case will more than likely be transferred to the Mental Health Pilot Project.  The state informs the court that a bed has opened up at the United Community Center.
Court modified the bail to $1,000.00 P.R. Bond with a turn over to Justice Point for transportation to the United Community Center.  The court ordered that the defendant must reside at that facility until further order of the court.
Case adjourned to Judge Rothstein's Court on 09/02/2015 at 08:30 a.m. for a final pretrial.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Case must be tried on or before 8/27/15.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Robert Irving Hayes not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advised that they were advised by Deputy District Attorney Altenburg that  more time is needed to determine status of defendant's eligible for mental health court.  Court ordered case scheduled for trial.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be heard before the Honorable Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.    Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  If any motions are to be filed, movant is to file by 8/10/15; response due by 8/20/15; reply due by 8/25/15.  All motions in limine, jury instructions, substantive jury instructions, and witness lists are due one week prior to the final pretrial date.  Court ordered case adjourned before Branch 25 on 9/02/15 at 8:30 a.m. and for SPEEDY jury trial on 9/16/15 at 9:00 a.m.
Defendant not to be produced for the next date.  Case converted to scheduling conference.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert Irving Hayes not in court, defendant in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel did not appear.  Case is adjourned for plea and sentencing before Branch 20. File retained in court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Robert Irving Hayes not in court, in custody.  
Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea hearing.  Parties awaiting decision from mental health court as to transfer of this case. Joint motion for adjournment granted by the court.  Adjourned plea hearing scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Robert Irving Hayes not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived his client's appearance.  Parties request a plea date; resolution to be reached in transfer to the mental health treatment court.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

State's Witness List, received and filed with:
 - State's Motion in Limine.
/submitted by defense counsel, received and filed.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Robert Irving Hayes not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived his client's appearance.  Final pretrial held.  Defense counsel advised that this case remains in trial posture.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial before Branch 20 on 6/15/15 at 8:30 a.m.

Certification of PRELIMINARY HEARING transcript commencing APRIL 7, 2015 received and filed. (12 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to WISCONSIN STATE PUBLIC DEFENDER ATTORNEY VINCENT P. GUIMONT, 819 NORTH 6TH STREET, 9TH FLOOR, MILWAUKEE, WI 53203.kl
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Case must be tried on or before:  7-20-2015.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Robert Irving Hayes not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of DeAnn L. Heard for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waives his client's appearance.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Court set the following filing schedule:  movant to file by 5/06/15; response due by 5/21/15; reply due by 5/26/15.  All motions in limine, jury instructions and witness lists are due within one (1) week of the final pretrial date.  Any alibi notices must be filed per statute.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defense counsel requested another scheduling date.  Court continued matter before Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Robert Irving Hayes not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of DeAnn L. Heard for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Same bail.

Defendant Robert Irving Hayes in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Robert Irving Hayes in custody.  Ron Dague for Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Todd Bohlen-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Milwaukee Public Market (ALL grounds, parking lots, adjacent sidewalks, stores, etc.)

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Intensive Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY ORDER/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Robert Irving Hayes in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  Defendant Robert Irving Hayes in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint; oral amendments set forth on the record.  The Court found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
